subject: Handicapped
Suits and Litigation
lead_paragraph: In a settlement that ends a civil lawsuit in federal court, the University of Michigan has agreed to nearly quadruple the number of seats accessible to persons with wheelchairs in its football stadium. There were 88 such seats in Michigan Stadium last season; by 2010, the number will increase to 329 in the main seating bowl along with an equal number of companion seats for fans accompanying disabled persons.
